intro: Noronhia mayottensis, commonly known as the Mayotte starwood, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
